verses.verse: My soul <WH5315> is weary <WH5354> of my life; <WH2416> I will leave <WH5800> my complaint <WH7879> on myself; I will speak <WH1696> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul. <WH5315>
I will say <WH559> to God, <WH433> Do not condemn <WH7561> me; show <WH3045> me why <WH5921> <WH4100> you contend <WH7378> with me.

Is it good <WH2896> to you that you should oppress, <WH6231> that you should despise <WH3988> the work <WH3018> of your hands, <WH3709> and shine <WH3313> on the counsel <WH6098> of the wicked? <WH7563>
Have you eyes <WH5869> of flesh? <WH1320> or see <WH7200> you as man <WH582> sees? <WH7200>
Are your days <WH3117> as the days <WH3117> of man? <WH582> are your years <WH8141> as man's <WH1397> days, <WH3117>
That you enquire <WH1245> after my iniquity, <WH5771> and search <WH1875> after my sin? <WH2403>
You know <WH1847> that I am not wicked; <WH7561> and there is none <WH369> that can deliver <WH5337> out of your hand. <WH3027>
Your hands <WH3027> have made <WH6087> me and fashioned <WH6213> me together <WH3162> round <WH5439> about; yet you do destroy <WH1104> me.
Remember, <WH2142> I beseech <WH4994> you, that you have made <WH6213> me as the clay; <WH2563> and will you bring <WH7725> me into <WH413> dust <WH6083> again? <WH7725>
Have you not poured <WH5413> me out as milk, <WH2461> and curdled <WH7087> me like cheese? <WH1385>
You have clothed <WH3847> me with skin <WH5785> and flesh, <WH1320> and have fenced <WH7753> me with bones <WH6106> and sinews. <WH1517>
You have granted <WH6213> me life <WH2416> and favor, <WH2617> and your visitation <WH6486> has preserved <WH8104> my spirit. <WH7307>
And these <WH428> things have you hid <WH6845> in your heart: <WH3824> I know <WH3045> that this <WH2063> is with you.
If <WH518> I sin, <WH2398> then you mark <WH8104> me, and you will not acquit <WH5352> me from my iniquity. <WH5771>

If <WH518> I be wicked, <WH7561> woe <WH480> to me; and if <WH518> I be righteous, <WH6663> yet will I not lift <WH5375> up my head. <WH7218> I am full <WH7646> of confusion; <WH7036> therefore see <WH7200> you my affliction; <WH6040>
For it increases. <WH1342> You hunt <WH6679> me as a fierce <WH7826> lion: <WH7826> and again <WH7725> you show yourself marvelous <WH6381> on me.
You renew <WH2318> your witnesses <WH5707> against <WH5048> me, and increase <WH7235> your indignation <WH3708> on me; changes <WH2487> and war <WH6635> are against <WH5973> me.
Why <WH4100> then have you brought <WH3318> me forth <WH3318> out of the womb? <WH7358> Oh that I had given <WH1478> up the ghost, <WH1478> and no <WH3808> eye <WH5869> had seen <WH7200> me!
I should have been <WH1961> as though I had not been; <WH1961> I should have been carried <WH2986> from the womb <WH990> to the grave. <WH6913>
Are not my days <WH3117> few? <WH4592> cease <WH2308> then, and let me alone, <WH7896> that I may take comfort <WH1082> a little, <WH4592>
Before <WH2962> I go <WH3212> from where I shall not return, <WH7725> even to the land <WH776> of darkness <WH2822> and the shadow <WH6757> of death; <WH6757>

A land <WH776> of darkness, <WH5890> as darkness <WH652> itself; and of the shadow <WH6757> of death, <WH6757> without <WH3808> any order, <WH5468> and where the light <WH3313> is as darkness. <WH652>
